intro: Jumellea usambarensis, commonly known as the Usambara jumellea, is a flowering plant native to the mountains of East Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
